snippet.title: Here's what it's like to eat a 10-course meal at Blue Hill at Stone Barns in New York, the farm-to-table mecca rated among the best restaurants in the world
snippet.content:
On the long driveway looping its way into Stone Barns, you hit a speed bump. It's time to slow down.
You come here to taste vegetables picked just that morning, assuming their true forms in unconventional combinations, elevated beyond anything you'd find in a supermarket.
Thirty-two miles outside New York City, the "" at Stone Barns takes the farm-to-table concept to a new level. It's a world-class restaurant situated on acres of farmland where produce and the very idea of food are constantly being reinvented.
Thirteen years and , Chef 's masterpiece is still a magical journey into the very soil.
Here's what it's like to tour the Stone Barns farm and eat a 10-course meal at the legendary Blue Hill restaurant.
